intro: Corchorus olitorius, commonly known as Ethiopian spinach, is a leafy vegetable native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are rich in nutrients such as iron and vitamin A. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The leaves are typically harvested before the plant flowers, ensuring maximum nutritional value.
